## PolyAsyncIterable.find() method

Returns the first element for which `func(element)` returns `true`<!-- -->, or `undefined` if it never does.

**Signature:**

```typescript
find<U extends T>(func: IndexedTypePredicate<T, U>, options?: ConcurrencyOptions): Promise<U | undefined>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

func


</td><td>

[IndexedTypePredicate](./polyethylene.indexedtypepredicate.md)<!-- -->&lt;T, U&gt;


</td><td>

A type predicate called for elements of `this`


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[ConcurrencyOptions](./polyethylene.concurrencyoptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Options for concurrency of this operation


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

Promise&lt;U \| undefined&gt;

A promise to the first element of the iteration for which `func` returned `true`

## Remarks

`func` will be called on elements of this iteration until it returns `true`<!-- -->, and then not called again.

The return type of this function is narrowed to the type asserted by `func`<!-- -->.
